# Purpose

Check if each variable in every data set is accounted for in the package documentation.

# Global code and functions

```{r load packages, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE}
# Load packages
library(tidyverse)
library(devtools)

# Load most recent version of discretewq
load_all()
```

# Import and Prepare Data

```{r import data}
# Create a list of all data sets in discretewq to run functions on
ls_all_datasets <- lst(
  baystudy,
  DJFMP,
  EDSM,
  EMP,
  FMWT,
  NCRO,
  SDO,
  SKT,
  SLS,
  STN,
  suisun,
  twentymm,
  USBR, 
  USGS_CAWSC,
  USGS_SFBS,
  YBFMP
)
```

# List variable names

All names:

```{r print all var names}
map(ls_all_datasets, names)
```

Just `_Sign` variables:

```{r print sign var names}
ls_sign_vars <- map(ls_all_datasets, ~ select(.x, ends_with("_Sign"))) %>% compact()

map(ls_sign_vars, names)
```

# Inspect Sign variables

Count unique values for each `_Sign` variable in each data set that includes them:

## EMP

```{r count unique vals EMP}
for (var in names(ls_sign_vars$EMP)) {
  ls_sign_vars$EMP %>% 
    count(.data[[var]]) %>% 
    print()
}
```

## NCRO

```{r count unique vals NCRO}
for (var in names(ls_sign_vars$NCRO)) {
  ls_sign_vars$NCRO %>% 
    count(.data[[var]]) %>% 
    print()
}
```

## USGS_CAWSC

```{r count unique vals USGS_CAWSC}
for (var in names(ls_sign_vars$USGS_CAWSC)) {
  ls_sign_vars$USGS_CAWSC %>% 
    count(.data[[var]]) %>% 
    print()
}
```
